summary: This bill amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to authorize grants to community colleges for high-quality workforce development programs. The Secretary of Labor will award grants competitively to eligible institutions to establish, improve, or expand such programs, focusing on in-demand industry sectors and providing opportunities for individuals to obtain recognized postsecondary credentials. The bill outlines application requirements, use of funds, and performance evaluation criteria, including reporting on program effectiveness and participant outcomes. Funding is authorized for fiscal years 2026-2031, with a focus on serving individuals with barriers to employment and incumbent workers.
